channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Google I/O 2021 preview: Google resurrects Wear OS and Android tablets?
item.description: The Google I/O schedule promises to resurrect some long-dead form factors.

item.title: GameStop FOMO inspires a new wave of crypto pump-and-dumps
item.description: Discord groups promise big earnings by manipulating the crypto market.

item.title: The chip shortage is driving up tech prices–starting with TVs
item.description: Some high-end televisions already cost 30% more than they did last summer.

item.title: Colonial Pipeline paid a $5 million ransom—and kept a vicious cycle turning
item.description: Stopping payments would go a long way to stopping ransomware.

item.title: China has successfully landed on Mars [Updated]
item.description: China has become only the second nation to make a soft landing on the red planet.

item.title: Pipeline attacker Darkside suddenly goes dark—here’s what we know
item.description: The closure may mean the group is ceasing or altering ops—or pulling an exit scam.

item.title: Researchers force two mice to hang out and induce FOMO in a third
item.description: Synchronized activity between brains seems to be the key to socializing.

item.title: Despite big Marvel and Star Wars shows, Disney+ falls short of targets
item.description: The limits to recent explosive streaming platform growth might be in sight.

item.title: ISPs claim broadband prices aren’t too high—Biden admin isn’t buying it
item.description: Biden still plans “bold action” to lower Internet prices despite heavy lobbying.

item.title: Mysterious health “attack” cases rise to 130, US officials confirm
item.description: The cases, linked to brain injuries, are still piling up, with one in the last few weeks.

item.title: TSMC is considering a 3 nm foundry in Arizona
item.description: The already planned 5 nm Arizona plant may be joined by a second, 3 nm plant.

item.title: Mount Vesuvius victims died just moments away from rescue
item.description: A skeleton unearthed at the site may belong to a high-ranking naval officer.

item.title: Multiple US agencies probing world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange
item.description: The IRS, DOJ, and CFTC are looking at potential criminal violations.

item.title: Google Pixel 6 leak shows off distinctive new design
item.description: Besides the all-new Google “Whitechapel” SoC, it’s reportedly getting a new design.

item.title: After Epic v. Apple namecheck, Itch.io runs one-day-only dev-friendly promo
item.description: Similar to “Bandcamp Fridays”—comes after Itch.io was disparaged in Epic v. Apple.

item.title: Ireland’s health care system taken down after ransomware attack
item.description: Doctors left unable to access patient records after “very sophisticated” attack.

item.title: Rocket Report: Starship orbital flight details, Ariane 5 may delay Webb launch
item.description: Also, Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft gets a new launch date.

item.title: Lenovo’s new “Go” brand of travel gear kicks off with a wireless-charging mouse
item.description: Also announced: a 20,000 mAh portable charger for users' various devices.

item.title: New users can get 3 months of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate for $1 today
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on iPhone cases, Garmin watches, and robot vacuums.

item.title: New analysis confirms hypothesis for source of mysterious auroral “dunes”
item.description: Ongoing collaboration between physicists and amateur stargazers yields new insights.

item.title: Tesla owner who “drives” from back seat got arrested, then did it again
item.description: Man jailed for leaving driver seat empty says he feels safer in back seat.

item.title: Vaccinated individuals can now go maskless in most indoor locations
item.description: With vaccines generally available and highly effective, the US shifts its advice.

item.title: Microsoft Surface Duo fire sale puts device at 50% off
item.description: Microsoft’s weird dual-screen Android phone hits the bargain bin.

item.title: Windows 10X is dead—long live Windows 10
item.description: It looks like Microsoft is abandoning its plans for the tablet-focused distro.

item.title: Musk: Bitcoin is bad for climate (and you can’t buy Teslas with it anymore)
item.description: Tesla CEO flip-flops, says that environmental concerns drove the decision.

item.title: Biden signs executive order to strengthen US cybersecurity
item.description: Move comes after high-profile hacks, including attack on crucial fuel pipeline.

item.title: Congress fires warning shot at NASA after SpaceX Moon lander award
item.description: “This bill, in the main, is not supposed to be about space.”

item.title: Real robotaxi service gets a step closer in San Francisco (Updated)
item.description: Waymo and Cruise have both applied for permits to deploy a commercial service.

item.title: Mass Effect Legendary Edition: Tests, thoughts, three hours of gameplay [Updated]
item.description: We archived our massive Twitch stream, plus tons of text, images about remastered Shep.

item.title: Steam’s “price parity rule” isn’t wreaking havoc on game prices
item.description: Game publishers aren’t “passing on the savings” from “cheaper” online storefronts.

item.title: Colonial Pipeline resumes operations after ransomware prompted closure
item.description: Closure led to panic-buying, price hikes, and other disruptions in East Coast states.

item.title: Vizio TV buyers are becoming the product Vizio sells, not just its customers
item.description: Vizio’s ads, streaming, and data business grew 133 percent year over year.

item.title: CDC advisory committee recommends COVID vaccine for 12- to 15-year-olds
item.description: Formal approval of the Pfizer/BioNTech by the CDC expected within 24 hours.

item.title: Amazon’s 2nd-gen Echo Show offers better cameras, CPUs, and speakers
item.description: Echo Show 8 features a 13mp wide-angle camera, 8-core CPU, and digital pan/zoom.

item.title: Better than holograms: 3D-animated starships can be viewed from any angle
item.description: Unlike holograms, the optical trap display produces images viewable from all angles.

item.title: Xiaomi and the US government bury the hatchet, settle investment ban
item.description: Trump’s DOD called Xiaomi a “Communist Chinese military company” in mid-January.

item.title: Neural implant lets paralyzed person type by imagining writing
item.description: A paralyzed individual hit 90 characters per minute, 99% accuracy.

item.title: $50 monthly broadband discounts available starting today via 825 ISPs
item.description: FCC’s emergency pandemic fund is open, with 825 home and mobile ISPs participating.

item.title: Snap suspends Yolo, LMK anonymous messaging apps after lawsuit over teen’s death
item.description: Lawsuit alleges messaging apps were “dangerous and defective.”

item.title: Valve’s Gabe Newell hints at vague console plans coming “this year”
item.description: Indefinite tease comes during Q�A with New Zealand students.

item.title: The best smartwatches for every type of user
item.description: We looked at smartwatches from every stripe, shape, and price point to find the best ones for your needs.

item.title: J&J vaccine supply has run out; Emergent says it’s working on improvements
item.description: Vaccine production at Emergent’s facility is still halted.

item.title: Volvo and Daimler bet on hydrogen truck boom this decade
item.description: Swedish and German groups expect fuel to challenge diesel in long-distance freight.

item.title: Aston Martin’s new boss tells us about the future of the company
item.description: Former AMG CEO Tobias Moers is now in charge of the British carmaker.

item.title: Famed Arthurian tale comes to silver screen in The Green Knight trailer
item.description: “Honor. That is why a knight does what he does.”

item.title: Rare fungal infections that destroy eyeballs and kill are on the rise in India
item.description: People with diabetes are particularly vulnerable to the aggressive fungus.

item.title: Ransomware crooks post cops’ psych evaluations after talks with DC police stall
item.description: Babuk demands $4 million, Metropolitan Police Department offers $100,000.

item.title: Nvidia’s RTX 3050 brings ray tracing and DLSS to $800 laptops
item.description: Performance-boosting DLSS on entry-level laptops could be a big deal.

item.title: Github reverses takedown of reverse-engineered GTA source code
item.description: Identical fork is restored after DMCA counterclaim.

item.title: Intel claims its new Tiger Lake-H CPUs for laptops beat AMD’s Ryzen 5000
item.description: Flagship Core i9-11980HK allegedly beats Ryzen 9 5900HX by 11 to 26 percent.

item.title: Our fave gentleman thief is back for revenge in trailer for Lupin part 2
item.description: Viewers frustrated by part 1’s maddening cliffhanger won’t have much longer to wait.

item.title: Baltimore chief prosecutor asks FCC to stop negative news coverage about her
item.description: First Amendment prevents FCC from punishing news station for its “tone.”

item.title: Apple’s MagSafe wireless charger is on sale for a new low price today
item.description: Dealmaster also has wireless headphones, Switch gear, and gaming monitors.

item.title: After many delays, Massachusetts’ Vineyard Wind is finally approved
item.description: The new project will be over 20 times larger than anything built in the US.

item.title: Samsung and AMD will reportedly take on Apple’s M1 SoC later this year
item.description: Exynos with an AMD GPU is coming for laptops, but maybe not phones?
